file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-23-04-07 - CONFIG-1 - GASPER SYSTEM MUFFLERS - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GASPER SYSTEM MUFFLERS - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives instructions to clean the gasper system. B. The gasper system is installed under the passenger cabin floor. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 21-23-04-100-801-A GASPER SYSTEM - CLEANING EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 21-23-04 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-23-04-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. GASPER SYSTEM - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the gasper system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 21-23-03-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 21-23-03-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 21-23-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 21-23-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 251HF Passenger cabin floor 252 252DF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Stiff-bristle brush To clean the screen 1 available Commercially Vacuum cleaner To clean the screen 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-1 21-23-04 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-009-A (1) Remove floor access panels 251HF and 252DF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the mufflers (AMM TASK 21-23-04-000-801-A/400). J. Cleaning Procedure (Figure 701) SUBTASK 140-009-A (1) Use a stiff-bristle brush at the first inlet muffler screen, to loosen the dirt. (2) Use the vacuum cleaner to aspirate the loosen dirt. (3) Clean the internal part of the mufflers. NOTE: If necessary use a vacuum cleaner. (4) Visually examine the inlet fan. (5) If applicable, remove the gasper fan (AMM TASK 21-23-03-000-801-A/400) and clean it (refer to CMM Technofan 21-25-04). (6) Make sure that there is no dirt on the surrounding area of the gasper fan. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-009-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel-quantity-indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel-quantity-indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) If applicable, install the gasper fan back (AMM TASK 21-23-03-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the mufflers (AMM TASK 21-23-04-400-801-A/400). (4) Install floor access panels 251HF and 252DF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-1 21-23-04 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
